values:
Remembering the chaos of the last move in, Briar opted out of joining the crowd and was instead in his room, reading the book he got from the library.  He was also curious to see who his new roommate was.

<font size=1>(Open like and open thing.  Especially for roomie)</font>

At some poin late at night, when Briar was minutes away from being asleep, he heard an odd noise. He jumped up and realized that it was simply Sandry trying to catch his attention. With a sigh, he let his head hit the pillow. Briar! Good morning! It's ... a little after midnight. What are you talking about? I couldn't sleep. Why should I suffer? Because Tris and Daja have gone out of range. Briar felt Sandry pout and sighed. What do you want to hear about? Anything. All right. Met a demon who apparently doesn't kill people anymore or something like that. Explained the tattoos to Cedric, Jack. And just generally met new people. And talked to people I've met already. Oh, and I may have gotten volunteered into doing radio again. ... Sandry? I don't even know where to begin. Briar chuckled. We also moved in to cabins. Did your classes start yet? Yup. I had First Aid, Astronomy, and Nature Magic. Sounds interesting. It is. Had a bit of insomnia a few days ago. Feeling better now? Yes. Is that a hint that you want to sleep. Yes. Sandry sighed. Talk with you later then

Briar was almost asleep when Sandry's voice rang through his mind. You're ignoring me! Am not! Are too! Am not! I haven't heard from you in six days! I'm learning my way around! So what did you learn? Briar could almost feel Sandry smiling truimphly and groaned. A bit of new slang.Televisions are weird. As are movie plots. What? It's usually best just not to ask. So what else. Girls around here really like it when guys are wearing shirts. And someone passed a new rule requiring everyone to have a nametag. That's everywhere. The girl's liking guys without shirts part. There is no one here who uses the same map as us and it makes for some odd conversations. And I think I accidentally broke a girl's brain. At least it wasn't her heart. Briar mentally stuck his tongue out at her. So this is probably a bad time to mention how I may trying to convince the girls to go topless next Friday? Sandry mentally thwapped him. Ow! Apparently this school has gremlins and other random monsters. ...What? That was my general reaction. And in closing news, I found Tris's long lost twin. What?! I don't have a twin! Tris chimmed in. I meant she reminds me of you, copper-curls. Her hair was setting of sparks? Ha. I try. Can I sleep now? You still promised to tell me about clothes! Girls pretty much only wear breeches. Briar smirked and mentally closed himself off. Within minutes he was asleep.

Briar glanced at his roommates empty bed and collapsed on to his own. He grabbed a pillow and made a brave attempt at strangling himself. Briar! Briar pressed the pillow down more. Sandry. I haven't seen you in an entire two days. I miss you. Discipline is just too quite. How have you been? What have you been up to in the past few days? Tris? Daja? Make her shut up? No. Nope. Briar groaned. Met my roommate who also happens to be a plant mage. I probably should have realized that most students here are on drugs when the first girl I met claimed to be a pretend princess. Erm, talked to my roommate some more. That was all yesterday. You didn't do anything today? Why do I have trouble believing that? There was a party in one of the common rooms where the other students were worshipping something called the TV. I don't get it either so don't make me explain! There were people. People who made me wonder if everyone here is insane. There was a guy with a box that recorded everything and a guy who was just plain weird. The girls were pretty and sane though. There were three snorts in his head. How soon will you be out of range? Never! Niko thinks two weeks or so. Maybe a month if we try really hard. Same here. What? So sick of us already thief-boy? Briar chose not to reply and ignored the laughter of his foster-sisters. All right, I'll leave you alone! But you are telling me what people are wearing tomorrow! I want to see if there are new fashions there! Yes, Sandry. Whatever you say Sandry. May I sleep now Sandry? He was answered by blessed silence.

After quickly escaping from the party for new students, and the slightly crazy girl, Briar found his way to his new room.  Dumping his bags by what he now declared to be his bed and went to care for his Shakkan.  He left the door open.

In Discipline cottage, chaos ruled.  

<lj-cut text="The Chaos">
"Little Bear, sit!"

"Tris, were'd you pu-never mind, found it!"

"I hope no one wanted milk today." *crash* "Or was too fond of that plate."

"I told you to begin packing last week Briar!"

The boy in question sighed and tossed a few more shirts into an open travel bag by the foot of his bed.

"She did tell you to start packing a week ago."  Sandry pointed out from the door way.  Briar glared and tossed in another shirt.

"I know they don't wrinkle but if you fold everything neatly it'll take up less room."  Without waiting for an answer, Sandry began re-packing Briar's bags.  

"Sandry?  They're pretty much limitless.  I could put Little Bear in there an-" Briar was interrupted by a loud knocking on the front door.

"Niko?  Is something wrong?"

"No, actually."  Niko raised his voice a notch.  "Briar?  Rosethorn?  Can I have a word please?"

Briar scowled at Sandry and headed to meet Niko.  "I have to finish packing."  He informed the older man.

"Sandry is doing a lovely job of it for you."  Niko replied with a small laugh.  "Actually, you won't be traveling with Rosethorn."

"What?"

"You'll be going to Fandom High instead."

"What?"

"It's an inter-dimensional school for unusual children."  Niko helpfully explained.

"...What?"

"Niko, what is the meaning of this?"

"It's a once in a life time opportunity and Briar will like it there, really!"

"How long will I have to stay there?"  

"As long as you wish.  But at least half-a-year."  Niko hurriedly added on.  "And they have a no weapons on campus rule."

Briar snorted.  "Right.  So half-a-year, I come home, and then I can go with Rosethorn?"

"..Yes."  Niko replied slowly.  "You'll leave tomorrow with the girls."

"Niko?"  Tris's voice echoed from upstairs.  "Niko I can't find my atlas!"
</lj-cut>
And Discipline once again fell into chaos.

There's a loud screech and then

<i>Hello?  Hi?  I just talk into this?  Um, all right.  This is Briar Moss and I was unable to figure out which button to press to get your phone call.  So leave a message and I'll make a brave attempt at calling you back.  Now what?  Oh, okay."  

And there's another loud screech.
